## Create a function that reads in and cleans a dataset

I chose to create a function that performs the 


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#create a function called "read_debt", f is the file name and by default is false
read_debt<-function(f){
#read in the data file
  d<-read_excel(f)%>%
#change the "year and quarter" to a date format
    mutate(date_orig = parse_date_time(`Year and Quarter`, orders="yq"))%>%
  select(-`Year and Quarter`)
}
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#read in dataset
debt_orig<-read_excel("_data/debt_in_trillions.xlsx")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error}
```
Error in read_excel("_data/debt_in_trillions.xlsx"): could not find function "read_excel"
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#apply function
debt_date<-debt_orig%>%
  read_debt()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error}
```
Error in read_excel(f): could not find function "read_excel"
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#check it out! 
debt_date%>%
  head()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error}
```
Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'debt_date' not found
```
:::
:::
